to capture hashes
command: sudo responder -I vboxnet0 -DPv
This will start listening to the network for flying llmnr and other requests
Once the user mistypes any file/directory/machine name (any host name), name resolution from dns fails (as nothing like that exists) as backup, llmnr requests are broadcasted in the server.
Nbt-ns, llmnr and mdns requests are broadcasted throughout the network, responder (since it's listening on the same network) captures the request and poisons them( responds in a malicious manner ig) claiming to know the hosts and requesting login credentials.
The said credentials are then sent by the client, in NTLMv2 hashes, which are captured by Responder while performing a MITM, this can then be saved in hash.txt:
